comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Most exchanges have notifications in a way it will alert you when a coin has increased. For other coins, example on Binance, you can click on the chart on both the sport or the future market, below it you will see alert. Click on the alert to set the price you want to be notified.You can also use TradingView.You can set alert on Coingecko and Coinmarketcap. I noticed that I am getting alert with price changes of the coins that I added to my portfolio on these sites. You can also set alert on some selected coins on the sites.

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: Coingecko works for me just fine, you can probably tweak it to your specifications so you only have a few crypto that's giving the alert. I have listed bitcoin in my Coingecko portfolio so it updates me of any significant move although I don't think it's going to be reporting small positive or negative moments but I can't be certain of that, I didn't tweak my Coingecko app too much.

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: Quote from: zigger33 on December 06, 2023, 09:59:30 AMim looking for an web ore mobile app something which is good does not need to be free...im looking for something which can imidietly report when a certain coin is going in like 10-30 minutes   10 % up  so you can maybe jump in and catch few %anyone can recommend something ?Are you searching for something that is automated and will do the work for you or are you searching for something that could give you a notification when a certain coin reaches a certain value based on your specifications? If it is the first option then I will suggest you not use such a thing for price prediction. When you rely on something other than yourself, it becomes complicated and the results are not going to be the one to your liking. People use bots or signal services but I never recommend anyone to use those. They can be accurate sometimes but not every time. And if you keep using those services, you will forget even the basics of trading in the long run. So don't use them. But if it's the second option, there are services available that will keep you up to date but you will have to do it manually.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: zigger33 on December 06, 2023, 11:47:18 AMis there any that can show 10-30 minute range of volumen and % change in crypto coins per different exchanges ?im searching for it but cannot find iti could only find 1 hour report changeIt seems that you need trading bots more than the profitable ALERT app. 10 minutes to 30 minutes is not a long time, and the human response will be slow, especially if trading is not your daily work. Trading bots, whether open source or paid, monitor the trading pair on several platforms over less than a minute, and you can program it to execute orders, for example, if the price decreases by such and such amount, sell or by such and such a percentage, or if the price changes in X exchange, sell in Y exchange.Everything you are looking for will be found in the trading bots, and you can set up notifications to be sent to you by email, and from the email you can view them on your phone or smart watch.

comments.author: ZAINmalik75
comments.body: Quote from: zigger33 on December 06, 2023, 09:59:30 AMim looking for an web ore mobile app something which is good does not need to be free...im looking for something which can imidietly report when a certain coin is going in like 10-30 minutes   10 % up  so you can maybe jump in and catch few %anyone can recommend something ?You can use Trading View's built-in trading view alert option, it has a bundle of options for web-based usage and it will also work on smartphones if you download the Trading View application. And the amazing thing is you can use Cryptohopper platform that generates buying and selling action API that you can add to your Trading view or any other alert app. You can use Coingecko or coinmarket cap too but the experience is not good with both and the fun fact is they both show you the average price of the market, i.e. BTC.Therefore you might not get a good deal, if you are planning to trade only one one or two exchanges. The best practice will be to use a built-in alert system of exchanges that you are going to use for making trades because each exchange does have small differences between the prices and the average prices from coinmarket cap and coin gecko might no be of any benefit to you.There are bundle of alert apps but they don't work efficiently, I suggest you to use telegram bots like https://cryptocurrencyalerting.com/bot/telegram

comments.author: el kaka22

I understand that there is a belief in some people that some other person could help you make a lot of profit, but those who could are not the people who want to and those who want to are not those who could.Meaning, people who are great at trading and could help you make money just like they do, are not the people who are going to help you since they are already making profit and won't bother helping you out, whereas people who do want to help you, are usually people who do not make a lot of profit from trading themselves so they want your money.

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: You can use any exchange to find out which coin is increasing at which time or what percentage of coin has increased, the total volume of that coin or the maximum increase. By using such exchanges you can only see the past and current statistics of the coins but if you think you will see where the coins will go in the future it is not really possible. No app can tell you when a coin's market will go in which direction, but different apps or exchanges will show you the statistics that have already happened and what is happening now. If you have the idea that you will only watch the price movement then I can suggest you CoinGecko, CoinMarketCap.
